Re: License #: CE130201005
Dear Tori Benden:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
10/13/23. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan
is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-552-3662 or
triestramc@michigan.gov.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements;
staff qualifications
• (1) Child caring institutions subject to 42 USC
671 shall not permit a child caring institution
staff member to begin working unless all of
the following has been completed using the
forms, and in the manner, prescribed by the
department:
• (b) A check of Michigan’s child abuse
and neglect central registry or
Canadian provincial agency as
referenced in R 400.4113(i).
One out of nine employee files did not have the central registry clearance
completed before hire. The central registry is completed but done after hire date.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1) An institution shall maintain employee
records for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
• (e) Three dated references which are
obtained prior to employment from
persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
Five out of six new employee files did not have references dated before hired date.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee

specified in this rule:
• (g) If the employee has criminal
convictions, the institution shall

One out of nine employee files did not have an agency evaluation concerning

CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee

One out of nine employee files did not have a performance evaluation completed.
the agency reported they have never completed performance evaluations for their

CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
• (1) When a resident is discharged from
institutional care, all of the following

• (a) The date of and reason for

Eight out of eight closed files did not have the new location of the child in the file.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
Audit was reviewed and they are in compliance.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
NA

Chief Administrator Assessment
I reviewed the assessment. All areas were completed.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews revealed a positive culture in the facility. Staff discuss good
relationships with the youth and with their co-workers and supervisors.
Youth spoke positively about the agency and did not voice any concerns. All youth
were able to recognize staff that are helpful.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Facility is well kept, and youth areas are clean.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
